basics.name: Jair Wuilloud
basics.label: Data Scientist / Engineer / Researcher
basics.summary: I see myself as an entrepreneurial problem solver and a team player.

work.summary: Consulting in data science for more than 30 entities, including well established companies and well founded startups. Some of the work is described below or in **Projects**.

I was invited by JUA.AI to build advanced weather models using deep learning. Starting from a blue sky project, within 6 months, I could identify, test, train and integrate models and data architecture components that became the core of currently the best weather model predictions on the market.

Interscript needed to use deep learning for diacritization and transliteration. Diacritization models were trained in arabic and hebrew, resp. reproducing and beating existing benchmarks. A new approach to transliteration allows now language experts to design the complex business rules necessary to generate the transliteration rules being put into production via data generation and the training of transformer architectures. The approach was presented in a small specialists conference.

With a Californian MD, we have developed an app allowing practitioner to easily model patient states and diseases and retrieve statistical evidences in real time via fuzzy search throughout the US healthcare dataset. The app focus on speed allows to run scenarii and test hypotheses.

Markus and Dennis had a vision for the future: one will soon interact with websites via language. My main contribution was the building of an IOS app, the agent and its brains and to run successful demos to potential customers.
Mediaplayers needed advices with data science and their data strategy. I have then built their data pipeline, processing .5 billion of behavioural data within 3 hours daily.

I have helped faxi with new GPS processing and carpooling recommendation algorithms. Thanks to an app that I have built, communities can now easily visualise the carpoolings and their benefits for their community in term of $ and CO2 emissions.

I have join the company to build new language models exploiting advantages of sparse representations. After 3 months, I developed a working model to encode and compress text that became the semantic engine after 6 months. This model was extended and tested on several business cases. The model proved to exceed some existing benchmarks, which we have documented in a paper.

TaxiQ was a collaborative system helping black cab drivers to navigate within the city by solving the problem of evaluating the latest waiting times on the taxi ranks. With a small budget, I have acted as a CEO in interim, putting a team of up to 8 people to build a MVP (web apps). My work included R&D, pitching, business plans, ...
Financial models validation and implementations on the C++ pricing libraries.

I was working on QCD and Supersymmetry simulations. Simulations allow to run virtual experiments and perform approximations necessary to do predictions and test the standard model. I have specialised in some technical aspects of DIrac's operator determinant evaluation.
